thread.title: Ant and Dec 'very excited' as they receive OBE's from the Prince of Wales at Buckingham Palace

author: Emma Powell
title: Ant and Dec 'very excited' as they receive OBE's from the Prince of Wales at Buckingham Palace

persons.name: ali astall john stillwell/pa  ant mcpartlin

organizations.name: house of fraser british academy television awards

text:
Ant and Dec ‘very excited’ as they receive OBEs from the Prince of Wales at Buckingham Palace 
The pair were honoured for their services to broadcasting and entertainment Friday 27 January 2017 12:11 BST Click to followES Entertainment Proud as punch: TV presenters Ant and Dec and their wives Lisa Armstrong and Ali Astall John Stillwell/PA 
Ant McPartlin and Declan Donnelly told fans they were “very excited” as they received OBEs from the Prince of Wales . 
The TV presenters were recognised for their services to broadcasting and entertainment at the investiture ceremony at Buckingham Palace on Friday. 
The Geordie duo were all smiles as they posed outside the palace in matching black and grey suits alongside their wives Lisa Armstrong and Ali Astall. 
Clearly looking forward to the special occasion, Donnelly tweeted: “V excited! D.” V excited! 
Despite rarely being seen apart, the pair were briefly split as they received their honours as individuals. 
Fans congratulated the pair on Twitter, with Scarlett Moffatt tweeting: "Congratulations @antanddec on your OBE #welldeserved." 
The investiture ceremony comes two days after the Geordie duo won their 16th Best Presenter gong at the National Television Awards . All smiles: Ant McPartline and Declan Donnelly (John Stillwell/PA) 
They fought off competition from Rylan Clark-Neal, Gary Lineker, James Corden and Great British Bake Off duo Mel and Sue to take the title. 
McPartlin and Donnelly rose to fame as PJ and Duncan in Byker Grove. On leaving the show in the early 90’s they launched their pop career under their character names and had success with BRIT Award nominated single, Let's Get Ready To Rumble. Ant & Dec Ant & Dec 1/20 
Anthony McPartlin (L) and Declan Donnelly, winners of Best Entertainment Programme for "Ant & Dec Saturday Night Takeaway", pose in the winners room at the House of Fraser British Academy Television Awards at Theatre Royal on 10 May 2015 Dave Benett

PJ and Duncan (Ant and Dec) in Byker Grove 
After releasing three albums, the duo turned their hand to presenting and fronted popular children’s shows including Gimme 5, The Ant & Dec Show and Ant & Dec Unzipped. 
In August 1998 they signed to ITV and became Saturday morning staples on SM:TV Live and CD:UK, which they presented alongside Cat Deeley. Read more
